result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis J. Hach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

No possession or consumption of alcohol.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any counseling and/or educational programming required by the agent.

Pay costs, including the DNA surcharge.  DNA sample to be submitting at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Credit in the event of revocation:  2 days.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Travis J. Hach
Current: 3102 Cty Y, Dodgeville, WI 53533 United States  (Effective: 11-18-2015)
Prior: 306 Main Street, Blue River, WI 53518

Defendant Travis J. Hach in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today was set to be the adj. initial.  DA Harper instructs the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  Per DA, State moves to amend to 1 count of misd. bail jumping for 1 year probation with no drink and any other recommendations of agent, along with costs and DNA requirement.  Court allows the amendment to misd. bail jumping.  To the charge, as amended, def pleads guilty.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  Withheld for 1 year probation with no drink condition.  Attend, pay for, succ. complete any counseling or educational programs required by agent.  Pay costs, including DNA surcharge.  Submit DNA sample at RCSD.  

Credit in event of revocation:  2 days.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Travis J. Hach. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis J. Hach not in court. DA states def is in custody in Lafayette County jail at this time. Requests recheduling.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis J. Hach did not appear. Atty McDougal for defense, states her client is in a facility. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA requests reset.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
From Grant Co DA requesting copies

Defendant Travis J. Hach in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def states he's hired Atty. Tim Angel but hasn't communicated with Atty. Angel yet re this matter.  This matter adj. to Feb. 4 at 9 when Atty. Angel is here on other matters.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 3, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

DA Harper and Def without counsel.  Def states he does not qualify for SPD; is making attempts to retain counsel on his own; asks for time.  No objection by DA.  Adj. to 12/3 at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 12-03-2014 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business.Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.

Defendant Travis J. Hach in court, in custody.  Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA requests $1000 cash bond with conditions. Court informs def of the charges and the bond set. Comment by def. Court orders $1000 signature bond with same conditions: no to possess alcohol, PBT upon request and no entry into bars/taverns or any place where sale of alcohol is primary business.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
